Class Stack 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----Stack
public class Stack
extends Object
A dynamic stack, which can contain integers.

Author:
Ethan Georgi

Stack()
Constructor with no arguments
Stack(int)
Constructor.

isEmpty()
Is the stack empty?
pop()
Remove the value at the top of the stack.
push(int)
Push an element on to the top of the stack.
replace(int)
Pop the top item and push the new item
show()
top()
Peek at the value on the top of the stack.
topop()
Returns the integer on the top of the stack and then pops it off the stack.

Stack 
 public Stack()
Constructor with no arguments

Stack 
 public Stack(int size)
Constructor.

Parameters:
size, - The size of the stack to create

push 
 public void push(int value)
Push an element on to the top of the stack.

Parameters:
value, - The value to place on the top of the stack.
top 
 public int top()
Peek at the value on the top of the stack.

Returns:
The value on the top of the stack.
pop 
 public void pop()
Remove the value at the top of the stack.

isEmpty 
 public boolean isEmpty()
Is the stack empty?

Returns:
TRUE is there is nothing in the stack.
replace 
 public void replace(int n)
Pop the top item and push the new item

Parameters:
n - The new integer to push
topop 
 public int topop()
Returns the integer on the top of the stack and then pops it off the stack. equivalent to top(); pop();

Returns:
The integer on top of the stack
show 
 public void show()
